WorkItem.ClosedComment: You'll need to explicitly save the file in UTF-8 or some other encoding that supports Unicode characters, it won't be done for you automatically just by having added a non ASCII character to the source.
WorkItem.Description:
Hi,
  In a typescript file I added this message

            if (iPrezzo != iVecchioPrezzo)
                alert("il cambio di prezzo verrà considerata rivalutazione");
  I have the lastest version of web essentials and when I save the file is compiled correctly, but when I go to build i receive this error message
 
Error	46	Build: Cannot read file '../_Edit.ts': Unsupported file encoding.	

   the problem is the à, with the accent, I suppose that adding not ASCII characters the file is saved as a unicode file.

  Luca
WorkItem.Summary: cannot compile using characters with accent
